headline.print_headline: French Face A Battle To Control Parliament
headline.seo: Parliamentary Elections in France Closely Watched by Hollande
headline.main: French Face a Battle to Control Parliament

docs.snippet: The fate of François Hollande’s young presidency rests largely on legislative elections that begin Sunday, as he seeks a large majority and the right tries to deny him one....
docs.abstract: France's upcoming parliamentary elections are expected to determine the extent and pace of reform under President Francois Hollande; deeply unpopular Nicolas Sarkozy has stepped aside, but his party, the center-right Union for a Popular Movement, is trying to beat back the tide and deny the Socialists and their leftist allies a large majority in Parliament; at the same time, Marine Le Pen and the far-right National Front are trying to capitalize on their good showing in the presidential race.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fate of François Hollande’s young presidency rests largely on legislative elections that begin Sunday, as he seeks a large majority and the right tries to deny him one.

headline.print_headline: Greeks Rally in Opener to Spoil Poland’s Party
headline.seo: Greeks Rally in Euro 2012 Opener to Spoil Poland’s Party
headline.main: Greeks Rally in Opener and Spoil Poland’s Party

docs.snippet: In coming from a goal down to tie their game against Poland, 1-1, Greece withstood all the fair elements of sport, and some decidedly unfair ones....
docs.abstract: Rob Hughes On Soccer column holds that in coming from a goal down to tie their game against Poland, 1-1, Greece withstood all the fair elements of sport, and some decidedly unfair ones, in their opening match of Euro 2012; other tournament results noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: In coming from a goal down to tie their game against Poland, 1-1, Greece withstood all the fair elements of sport, and some decidedly unfair ones.

headline.print_headline: After Edwards Trial, Much Returns to Normal, but Not All Is Set
headline.seo: After John Edwards Case, Much Returns to Normal
headline.main: After Edwards Trial, Much Returns to Normal, but Not All Is Set

docs.snippet: Now that the trial has ended, John Edwards’s family, the jurors and others are moving on, but there is still a chance that the case will be pursued further....
docs.abstract: Participants in the trial of John Edwards are all moving on, although there is still a chance that the case will be pursued further; Edwards himself has not granted any interviews, but his mistress Rielle Hunter is set to release a memoir called What Really Happened: John Edwards, Our Daughter, and Me.

byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON and JOHN SCHWARTZ

docs.lead_paragraph: Now that the trial has ended, John Edwards’s family, the jurors and others are moving on, but there is still a chance that the case will be pursued further.

headline.print_headline: Protesters Gather in Cairo Amid Escalating Tensions
headline.seo: Protesters Gather in Cairo Amid Escalating Tensions
headline.main: Protesters Gather in Cairo Amid Escalating Tensions

docs.snippet: Thousands of Egyptians protested in Tahrir Square on Friday amid anxiety over the upcoming presidential runoff and fears that former President Hosni Mubarak’s conviction will be reversed....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Demonstrators gather in Tahrir Square in Cairo to rally against the candidacy of Ahmed Shafik, former military commander, for president; protesters are threatening to boycott the vote, infuriating supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood candidate Mohamed Morsi.
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of Egyptians protested in Tahrir Square on Friday amid anxiety over the upcoming presidential runoff and fears that former President Hosni Mubarak’s conviction will be reversed.

headline.seo: Belmont and NBC Lose Their Star Before the Main Event

docs.snippet: As a result of I’ll Have Another’s being scratched the day before the Belmont Stakes, NBC’s ratings and the racetrack’s attendance will probably take a big hit....
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column notes that I’ll Have Another’s scratch from the Belmont Stakes will likely mean a big hit for NBC’s ratings and the racetrack’s attendance.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a result of I’ll Have Another’s being scratched the day before the Belmont Stakes, NBC’s ratings and the racetrack’s attendance will probably take a big hit.

headline.print_headline: Recovering, Se Ri Pak Is Leading In a Major
headline.seo: Back from Injury, Se Ri Pak Leads L.P.G.A. Championship
headline.main: Back from Injury, Se Ri Pak Leads L.P.G.A.

docs.snippet: Pak’s solid performance for the second straight day at the Locust Hill Country Club seemed to signal to the rest of the field that this 25-time winner was back and ready to win once again....
docs.abstract: Se Ri Pak takes second-round lead at the LPGA Championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pak’s solid performance for the second straight day at the Locust Hill Country Club seemed to signal to the rest of the field that this 25-time winner was back and ready to win once again.

headline.print_headline: Obama Expresses Support For Philippines in China Rift
headline.seo: Obama Shows Support for Philippines in China Standoff
headline.main: Obama Expresses Support for Philippines in China Rift

docs.snippet: In a meeting with President Benigno S. Aquino III, President Obama said the two countries would “consult closely together” as part of the “pivot by the United States back to Asia.”...
docs.abstract: Pres Obama, in meeting with Filipino Pres Benigno S Aquino III, expresses support for Philippines in its maritime dispute with China; two countries have been locked in a tense standoff for two months over rights to a cluster of reefs and rocks in the South China Sea known as Scarborough Shoal.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a meeting with President Benigno S. Aquino III, President Obama said the two countries would “consult closely together” as part of the “pivot by the United States back to Asia.”

headline.print_headline: Court Forces a Rethinking of Nuclear Fuel Storage
headline.seo: Court Says Nuclear Agency Must Rethink Fuel Storage
headline.main: Court Forces a Rethinking of Nuclear Fuel Storage

docs.snippet: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission must consider that a permanent repository for spent fuel may never be established, a federal appeals court ruled on Friday....
docs.abstract: Federal appeals court rules that the Nuclear Regulatory Commission acted hastily in concluding that spent fuel can be stored safely at nuclear plants for the next century in the absence of a permanent repository; rules that the commission must consider what will happen if a permanent repository is never established.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission must consider that a permanent repository for spent fuel may never be established, a federal appeals court ruled on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Desperate Ugandans Seek Makeshift Healers as Mysterious Illness Strikes Young
headline.seo: Ugandans Turn to Healers for Mystery Disease
headline.main: Desperate Ugandans Seek Makeshift Healers as Mysterious Illness Strikes Young

docs.snippet: Despite striking in a region receiving considerable development aid, nodding disease has confused doctors in Uganda, where it has killed more than 200 children since January....
docs.abstract: People of Ojuru, Uganda, are turning to traditional healers for nodding disease, a mysterious ailment that has stalked the brains and nervous systems of thousands of children in this part of Africa; debilitating disease stunts growth, causes mental retardation and sets off sudden seizures; no one knows what causes it, and it appears to attack only children; since January, more than 200 Ugandan children have died from the disease.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite striking in a region receiving considerable development aid, nodding disease has confused doctors in Uganda, where it has killed more than 200 children since January.
